options.text: "We need to have a grand old national anthem," reminiscences retired war veteran @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "It ought to be a strong, rousing tune to unite a broken nation. A proud tune for a proud people! Put in some references to a flag stained in the blood of the enemy: if the unpatriotic moralising minority doesn't like it, then they can get the heck out!"
options.result: the nationalistic national anthem inspires citizens to literally spit at foreigners

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "@@NAME@@ must be defined by its faith," voices chorister Al Winters, adopting his favourite holier-than-thou smug expression. "@@FAITH@@ indeed has an anthem you can adopt for @@NAME@@: an old hymn giving thanks for one people under @@FAITH@@. With it, we can lift our prayers to the kingdom above, and tell the world that we are a Chosen People!" [[color=purple]Must have a national faith[/color]]
options.result: the national anthem is considered broadly offensive to those who don't believe in @@FAITH@@

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "That's not what @@NAME@@ stands for in our modern age," rebuffs avant-garde composer @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "We're a pan-cultural nation of pan-humanity. I've composed an audiotheatrical tribute to the tribe of all life, with whale-song, echoing voices in ethnic dialects, and the laughter of children. I call it The Peace of @@NAME@@."
options.result: the national anthem is a rather effective sleeping aid

options.text: "Riiiiight. A whale-song national anthem? He can definitely 'PEACE OFF'!" replies annoying pun-spitting radio DJ @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "Of CHORUS we need something catchier and poppier. We shouldn't be aVERSE to a bit of JINGLEISM. Why not let the listeners vote for an anthem? You could call it... COUNTRY'S music. Ha ha, I'm so funny!"
options.result: citizens have voted the song "@@LEADER@@ Smells Like @@A@@ @@ANIMAL@@" as their new national anthem

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: museums and concert halls
policiesAndNotabilities.name: museums and concert halls

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: suspicion of poets
policiesAndNotabilities.name: suspicion of poets

options.text: "Why not an anthem that celebrates our merged culture of artificial and human intelligence?" suggests @@RANDOM_NAME@@, a third-generation cloud-based AI. "If you ask me, I'm tired of science taking a backseat to religion and pre-machine pre-history. I can write you a machine-friendly binary pulse barrage that both sounds really funky and has meaningful data within it if you run it as a program." [[color=purple]Must have AI citizens[/color]]
options.result: the new national anthem passes the Turing Test

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

options.text: "The nation is you, dear leader, and you are the nation," reminds the biggest suck-up in the office. "An anthem should sing your praises and be entitled Ode To @@LEADER@@. We can work on the words and the tune later: the important thing is the subject matter." [[color=purple]Must have unlocked @@LEADER@@[/color]]
options.result: the national anthem's only purpose is to inflate @@LEADER@@'s ever-expanding ego

options.text: "We don't need subject matter to worry about or lyrics for the plebs to sing," chimes in snobby classical musician @@RANDOM_NAME@@, smacking your staffer's head with a flute. "We must create a modern masterpiece, a magnum opus that will raise @@NAME@@'s spirits, a musical composition to define our nation. Summon the nation's greatest composers and an orchestra of the finest musicians. We'll give you a National Symphony and an anthem that will last forever!"
options.result: you need two tenors and a coloratura contralto to sing the national anthem properly

policiesAndNotabilities.name: complete lack of public education

options.text: "National anthem? Bah!" scoffs resident anarchist and constant thorn-in-your-side @@RANDOM_NAME@@. "We don't need this government forcing that patriotic drivel down our throats! Besides, most @@DEMONYM_PLURAL@@ are terrible singers! That's the last thing I want to hear at a football game!"
options.result: patriotic citizens simply tend to applaud rather than sing the nation's praises
